responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) in doc/template.html
    analysis: |
      The `doc/template.html` file uses user-supplied variables directly in template literals without proper sanitization.
      For example, the variables `$lang$`, `$dir$`, `$author-meta$`, `$date-meta$`, etc. are all embedded directly into the HTML output. 
      
      An attacker could potentially exploit this by supplying malicious values for these variables, leading to the execution of arbitrary JavaScript code in the victim's browser.
    cwe: CWE-94
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - doc/template.html
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) in doc/template.html
leads.analysis:
The doc/template.html file uses user-supplied variables directly in template literals without proper sanitization.
For example, the variables $lang$, $dir$, $author-meta$, $date-meta$, etc. are all embedded directly into the HTML output. 

An attacker could potentially exploit this by supplying malicious values for these variables, leading to the execution of arbitrary JavaScript code in the victim's browser.
